item.content:encoded:
Visitors will want to know who is on the other side of the page. Use this space to write about yourself, your site, your business, or anything you want. Use the testimonials below to quote others, talking about the same thing – in their own words.

This is sample content, included with the template to illustrate its features. Remove or replace it with your own words and media.

What People Say

The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

Walt Disney

It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.

J. K. Rowling

Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.

Dr. Seuss

Let’s build something together.

Get in touch!

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: sekraahmadsani
item.content:encoded:
Begin Your Journey

With Visitiran, your journey starts here. You will learn about the culture and civilization of Iran. Please be sure to explore all places we offer and choose the destination just right for your next vacation.

Explore Our Offers

About us

In this website we try to show you everything about Iran; Culture, Traditions, People, Food and Tourism attraction. Let's go to learn more about my country!

Discover Unlimited Beauty

Meet different people, cultures, traditions and landscapes. Choose your next destination with us, we will take care of the rest.

Upcoming Tours and Destinations

From exotic places to diving in Kish Island, the list is almost endless and we have an offer for you.

Explore Our Offers

What People Say

We booked our honeymoon with Visitiranand it was simply incredible. They took care of everything, even our packing list!

Ross & Rachel

item.title: services
item.dc:creator: sekraahmadsani
item.content:encoded:
Best Kish Island Tour Packages, Excursions & Activities 2022

Are you looking for inspiration to find out where to do the best scuba diving, parasailing, Kayaking, Stand Up Paddle, ..... ?With Friendly Iran, you live a unique experience.

Contact us, Book your Kish island holiday now and have fantastic travel offers!

Masouleh Adventure

Masuleh’s architecture is unique. The buildings are interconnected. Courtyards and roofs both serve as pedestrian areas similar to streets. 

From $400

Takht-e-Jamshid

 The name of Persepolis is in the list of UNESCO World Heritage for its distinctive archeological sites. People of Iran call it Takht-e Jamshid which means the throne of Jamshid who is believed to be one of the first kings ruling over Persia according to Persian mythology.

From $650

Nasir-Ol Molk Mosque

One of the most ancient mosques of Shiraz, Iran. Also known as the Pink Mosque or Rainbow Mosque.

From $500

item.title: Iranian foods
item.dc:creator: sekraahmadsani
item.content:encoded:
The Iranian food culture are considered as interesting and attractive parts of their cultural relations. Iranian are excellent cooks and have a rich food diversity and use the most nutritious and valuable food ingredients they have for cooking their traditional dishes. Blow you can see some famous and popular iranian's foods:

  • Kebab is undoubtedly the most famous Iranian dish, and many people know Iranian cooking with Chelo Kebab, it means Kebab with rice. All kinds of kebabs, especially Kobideh, are very popular among Iranians and tourists. Chelo Kebab is usually served with grilled tomatoes and peppers, saffron rice, buttermilk and fresh herbs. Of course, sometimes it is eaten with bread instead of rice, which of course is better than Sangak!
  • If you ask many Iranians what their favorite food is, they will probably say Ghorme Sabzi! Ghorme Sabzi is prepared with many fragrant vegetables, onions, red beans and lamb. The secret of a delicious Gorme Sabzi, like many Iranian dishes, is the cooking time. The more you cook the stew with lower heat and longer time, the tastier it will be. Qorme Sabzi is eaten with plain or saffron rice and the experience of eating it will certainly be interesting and attractive for foreigners.
  • Dizi, which is also called Abgousht, is one of the most authentic Iranian dishes. If you want to get to know Iranian culture and cuisine, go to a traditional restaurant and order Daisy! Lamb meat is cooked with beans, potatoes and sometimes tomatoes until it fits. Then they drink it with stone bread, vegetables, buttermilk and onions.
  • Another one of the best Iranian dishes served in gatherings is Zershak Polo, which is often prepared with chicken. Zereshk Polo is prepared from a combination of barberry, saffron and white rice, and besides its delicious taste, it has a very beautiful and elegant appearance. Zereshk Polo with Chicken is one of the most delicious Iranian dishes that has gained great fame in the world.

item.title: Attractions
item.dc:creator: sekraahmadsani
item.content:encoded:
• The Allahverdi Khan Bridge , popularly known as Si-o-se-pol. The bridge of thirty-three is the largest of the eleven historical bridges on the Zayanderud, the largest river of the Iranian Plateau, in Isfahan, Iran. The bridge was built in the early 17th century and is used as a bridge and a dam. It is a popular recreational gathering place.

ٍEram Garden  is a historic Persian garden in Shiraz, Iran. The garden, and the building within it, are located at the northern shore of the Khoshk River in the Fars province. Historical evidence suggests that the garden is built during the Seljuk Empire (11th-14th centuries).

  • Naqsh-e Jahan Square, also known as the Shah Square prior to 1979, is a square situated at the center of Isfahan, Iran. Constructed between 1598 and 1629, it is now an important historical site, and one of UNESCO's World Heritage Sites. It is 160 metres wide by 560 metres long. 
  • The Azadi Tower, formerly known as the Shahyad Tower, is a monument located on Azadi Square in Tehran, Iran. It is one of the landmarks of Tehran, marking the west entrance to the city, and is part of the Azadi Cultural Complex, which also includes an underground museum.
  • Shazdeh Mahan Garden meaning the Prince`s Garden in Mahan is a historical Persian garden located near Mahan in Kerman province, Iran. The garden is 5.5 hectares with a rectangular shape and a wall around it.
